lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons and Dragons. I think we're recording, because my camera light's not on, but nevertheless, welcome. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're totally recording.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm pretty sure we are. Anyway guys, welcome, we have a fantastic guest who will be joining us later this evening, but before we get to that we have announcements to go over real fast. First and foremost, tonight's episode is sponsored by a new sponsor, a fantastic group called Quidd! If you want to talk about that first?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi, guys. Vacation Sam here. Quidd is our sponsor tonight, a fantastic new sticker app for your phone. You can check it out at bitly, that's bit.ly/crquidd. I didn't know much about the company, but Quidd sounded vaguely British, so little-known fact about me, I have access to the BBC archives at home, so I did some snooping and sure enough, I found a World War II newsreel transcript that talked about Quidd, so I thought I would do a dramatic reading of it for you right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here we go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm John, an American. We American GIs love to collect stickers from brands like Rick and Morty, Bob's Burgers, Family Guy, Breaking Bad, Star Trek, and newly announced Game of Thrones. Take that, Emperor Hirohito! Well, there you have it, ladies and gents. Your British Armed Forces and our allies will defeat the Nazis and win the Second Great War if you go to bit.ly/crquidd and check out Quidd. Good night, good luck, and god save the queen, pip pip! (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so glad that's available on the BBC.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it was a weird transcript. I would have shown the newsreel, but it was just a transcript.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough. Well, thank you for the update on that, and thank you, Quidd for sponsoring tonight's episode. Really appreciate it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did they win the war?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Find out next time! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, let's see. Do you have any merch updates at all, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's stuff in the store!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pre-orders go up on Monday, guys!

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: What!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and if you get the book and the pdf, I think the pdf is available immediately, so some of you will have access to actually read the book on Monday.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you so nervous, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm so nervous. (laughs nervously)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: People can actually, in real time, call us when we're wrong on our own stuff.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you mean, finally? They do that every week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Finally? Although you are Taliesin Jaffe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a level of pain I've only dreamed of; I'm very excited.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey. We're so proud of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, nice job with the words and stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold on though, we haven't read it yet. What if it's terribly written, by a child?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll find out he used crayon. It's all written in marker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably. Do you know how hard it is to get crayon printed these days?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Only if the writers' room dropped the ball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I hope you guys enjoy it, so look forward to that. The podcast is now episodes 11 through 20, right? Up on the Apple Store. So you can go ahead and download those, which are awesome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yep, Apple and Google Play.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. And those are the ones. Of course we'll have Talks Machina next Tuesday at 7:00pm about this episode tonight, here on Twitch and Alpha, 7:00pm Pacific, with our fantastic host Brian Foster, so you can check that out. Wednesday Club next week for you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Other than us. Thank you, I was very proud of last night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're not having a show next week, we're going to be at Comic Con. Yeah, we have a week off. So we'll miss you guys next week, but we do have our Critical Role panel on Saturday at Comic Con, it's at 10:30am in Room 6...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: BC... E.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a nice big room. You guys should come, we're going to have silly questions, Q and A, conversations, stories and a lot of funness and some cool surprises!

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Prizes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Surprises!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, we have some announcements.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So hopefully you guys can make it at San Diego Comic Con. If you're going to be there we'd love to see you. And last but not least, Sagas of Sundry: Dread. The third episode went up today.

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA
lines.text: (perfect unison) Shit's getting real.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's that? Oh that's right, and at GenCon next month we have our live show, we mentioned it last week. Tickets are still on sale for the general admission. We're looking forward to having you guys there, it's Friday evening.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There are definitely tickets still available, it's going to be super fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like with that many people we should have beach balls in the audience, and they can do the wave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Inflatable d20s to throw out there...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps) You can get them. They're on ThinkGeek I think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a terrible idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a great idea!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You then walked through the orchards that led to the Fortress of the Sun where he resides, spoke with some of the guardians there, and were led into the center of the citadel, where you met, in the central throne room under the Zenith Tower, Pelor himself. Upon exchanging information, you spoke of your need to gather the favor of certain gods in the battles to come, and were given a challenge. To step up to plate: Vex'ahlia. You accepted the challenge and racing to the top of the tower, the zenith, before the fires could be extinguished in the brazier that awaited you, you threw yourself into the fire, and upon the party speaking on what it was that made Vex'ahlia such an important member of not just your team, but your family, and gave you strength, she was imbued with a blessing of the Dawnfather himself. After which, we left off as you exited the front of the Fortress of the Sun, stepped into the central glade that marks the center of the seemingly endless orchards that surround this region, and Vox Machina, what would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eat all of the fruit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was really good. It was just fruit, by the way. Like I said.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're still in heaven right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're still in Elysium.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not quite heaven.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any other gods here that we should curry favor with? For? Of?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any more gods here? Not that we know of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We forgot to ask.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I don't think Ioun is here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're looking at the series of the Sun Tree cousins, one of which you've met, scattered amongst this glade surrounding the central citadel.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What a douche.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No other people? Guards? Nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the guards behind you, the large planetar and deva entities that stand there, armored in their golden plate, after ushering you out, are standing guard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we can ask them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I'll go up to one and say, hello there, big fellow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Standing a full ten feet taller than you, practically, the wings slightly bent, the large planar entity kneels down. "Hello."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello. Vacation Scanlan here. Couple questions. By the way, was he one of the ones who fought in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Do they all look alike? 17 plus one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hard to tell. You didn't pay a lot of attention.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Hey, just wondering, a few questions.

lines.name: A
lines.text: How does one get out of here? Is there a door to another plane?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I imagine the same way you came in."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Number two: Are there any other like your Dawnfather around here? Any other gods in the area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Across Elysium, there are two deities that call it home: the Dawnfather and the Everlight."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we covered our bases. Out of curiosity: What are you called?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks very closely, and you get sense that part of its nature is scanning through you; it's getting a sense and a read of you as an individual, and it says, "No one you need to worry "about." Stands up and then takes two steps back (heavy footfalls) into place and looks straight ahead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, you should remember that line, that's a good one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. I already forgot it. I'm too intimidated. Was it no one or something? I don't know. Well, good speaking to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still looks out. Doesn't respond.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, how do we get out of here? Can she take us home?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She does on the daily.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, but I don't know. They talked about some sort of a gate that keeps the gods out and the bad gods in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was talking about possibly... or at least there was the Trammel, the Prime Trammels that were used previously to seal the Chained Oblivion, Tharizdun, and that the orchestrator, the designer of those was Ioun, the Knowing Goddess. Ioun, however, has sealed herself away, being a wounded god, long recovering, and the only information that Pelor has of where she hid herself, the key, essentially, is not an object but a person. You're seeking an individual, of which you were given a solar light map of a single small home in a forest ravine not far from a place that you've noticed was near the Pools of Wittebak, which is in the Cliffkeep Mountains.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but there was also a mention of some Divine Gate that keeps people from--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the Divine Gate is a known existing entity. It's essentially a large gate that prevents the gods from returning to the Prime Material Plane.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like a metaphysical screen door that keeps flies out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So the gods can't get in and out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, the Prime Trammel. Which we now have to get--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to get near the the Cliffkeep Range, near the Pools of Wittebak, is where we need to go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And the Cliffkeep is not too far from Whitestone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cliffkeep Mountains go across a lot of the northern side of Tal'Dorei, from what you're familiar with. Like, we're talking Kraghammer to Gatshadow to the Jorenn Village. There's a lot of things. It's like a big horizontal mountain range that caps the top part of the continent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I recognize the city that I can get us to that's close?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fort Daxio or Kraghammer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Haven't been to Kraghammer for a while, although Daxio might be worth a check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's closest to the pools?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those are the two that are closest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is Terrah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Terrah's not your home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. Sorry, Terrah is the Earth Ashari.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My other home, summer home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The home away from home.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you also remind me where my Vecdar made me feel Vecna-- where on the Prime Material Plane?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Oh, where?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we talked about it, but I can't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did, yes. It seemed to be hundreds of miles northwest of Vasselheim. You didn't sense any movement, but you knew the general direction and distance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And that was yesterday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Teacher?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was excited the last game and somehow have misplaced my Pelor champion piece of paper.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, she doesn't get to have it now. That's how that works.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how it happened! It's not with my stuffs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay, I remember what it does, and if you decide to use it--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You'll tell me? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I won't tell you. You tell me you want to use it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, okay. I'm sorry. I had it, and it's not here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's weird how he's so nice and yet it still feels like you are in so much trouble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm in a lot of trouble, you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's calm, but indifferent. Like the Dawnfather.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so what would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, what would we like to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should we go to Terrah? Check in with them, I guess, while we're there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seems prudent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And talk to Pa'tice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. We ready to go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very ready to go. This is lovely and everything, but I've had my fill.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will burn my 8th-level spell slot to Plane Shift us to Terrah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To Terrah, all righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mind the gap.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What gap?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't worry about it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No effects from eating that fruit, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you didn't sense any effects from that fruit, at the moment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't remove a curse or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you didn't. Nothing really caught you up to speed, in that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we by those fruit trees again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are no fruit-bearing trees directly near you. The Sun Trees are around you. Further in they do, yes. All righty. Bringing up my notes on Terrah, since that's where you're going.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I should probably--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we go to Ioun, and we don't have everything we need for this Prime Trammel, are we fucked? I know we need godly power in order to imbue them, right? Or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Either here or soon we need to sit and work this out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we need to bring into the trammel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, Pelor gave me this. Snap, snap, snap, zip. This. It's a stone and it's supposed to be strong enough to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Power the trammel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Part of it? Not all of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We need to collect more, though, right? We have to get like eight or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, it said that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You weren't given any indication as to how many you needed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it did seem like this is not enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no, wait, Ioun was healing for eight centuries. That's where I got that number. Sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I could do it, too. Five. Five stones of power.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you complete your spell, Keyleth, you step through the base of the nearest tree, possibly the same one you spoke with earlier if you want to be a dick about it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That sounds worse for us. But fuck it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you aggressively stampede through the center of this one tree and emerge on the other side from one of the surrounding trees on the Terrah village. There are a number of these pseudo-petrified or dried-out large-trunk trees that seem to have slowly died off from the heavy tectonic shifts and small quakes that happen in this area, that have made a lot of the land unable to support large forms of plant life, or at least the trees that used to exist here. So you step out and emerge from the exterior of the village as it domes down into this small crater that you recall seeing before, where most of the village inhabits the central portion, and the village is there before you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were the shard things called again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The shard things?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The things we need to collect?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There wasn't really a name for them more than they're small pieces of essence of the deity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we need pieces of god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does the little seed of light given to my sister look anything like the little seed that Scanlan and Vax saw from riding the shadow creature in the sky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. In a sense that it's a small source of power of some kind, but what you saw there was maybe about that large on the platform. What she has is bead size.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it this size? Or this size?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comparable to each. So you stand outside of Terrah. What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What time of day is it? How tired are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Based on when you left, it would still be probably-- well, you were over in Vasselheim, which means it's getting dark, actually. I'd say with the way the sun has passed through the sky now, you've just gotten past dusk. There's still light in the sky, but it's going from oranges to purples to dark blues on the horizon, and you can see hints of firelight, torchlight and candlelight from within the actual city below.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, what are we going to need on this trip? Maybe we should get whatever supplies we need. Is it far? Are we going to become gas?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we going underground?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, to Terrah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we'e in Terrah. But the next day, we're going to the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To the pools.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we want to stay the night here, then? I can't mist us right now. I'm tapped out. Camp here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax? Can you sense Vecna? Is he still in the same place?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can sense him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can sense him. He is, from your current location, thousands of miles from you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, hard to tell, then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's still really shitty, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, very heavy west-northwest direction from you, currently.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, sleep? Do we need to get any intel on where these pools are? Do we need anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should maybe talk to the people of Terrah? It's not that late.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's go. They have a spare room for us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you the leader of all the people?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm the leader of the Air Ashari and the Voice of the Tempest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that a yes or a no? You don't have to fucking brag.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, there's four of us, and I'm one of the four.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know the one who lives here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then let's go see him or her. Or they.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we can just go, like I was saying five minutes ago. Let's just go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So as you walk down into the village, a number of the guardians step out quickly, seeing an approaching party, however, recognizing Keyleth and her station immediately, turn into an escort that leads you to the center portion of the village.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I request Pa'tice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Quickly enough, they go and retrieve Pa'tice. You see the elderly form of the leader you've met before step out, the graying hair, the weathered dark skin tones, the long greens and brown leathers that drape off, showing hints of the knees and lower feet, the large walking staff that he carries at his side as he approaches and the headdress that seems to be a combination of thick twines and shale shards that have been woven in, steps forward. "Keyleth. An unexpected visit, "most definitely."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kaitiaki.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Kaitiaki."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pa'tice, I am so sorry for the late intrusion. We've just gotten back from the plane of Elysium, so we're a little tired. Yeah, we're fighting a god right now, well, more of like a demi-god, so have you heard of Vecna? Sorry, I'm probably getting ahead of myself. Do you have any food? Let's talk over dinner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have food, yes. You are guests of Terrah. Please, we will provide whatever you "require. Come, provide them a meal!" And he puts his hand out and they run off quickly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like that people just feed us. We show up, and there's food.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've been used to that your whole life.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not at home.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have to sing for dinner. You just say--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have you ever tried not singing for dinner?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe I'll get more food.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You might!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You did have one year-ish where you were on the skids. You did your Prince and the Pauper bit for a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a big vague, but yes. I was on a boat for quite a while.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god, can we eat food? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And quick as that, you guys make your way down. It's a modest meal, but it's a meal nonetheless. Mostly hunted creatures of the local mountainside, some dried beets and root.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We always try to source locally.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Charmingly provincial.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth, perhaps you should let your people know that the world is in danger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So the world's in danger, as she said--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The waiter is like, what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Runs out the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw shit! I just induced panic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We are awaiting word of what to do other than keep "ourselves in a defensive position. We have to guard the rift, of course. But should there be a "call to action, we'll do what we can. I'm unfamiliar with this Vecna, but whatever you plan, "please be careful."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sighs) Okay. More than anything, I think I would want you all to be relief for the surrounding area and surrounding villages if anything disastrous were to happen. I know you have to guard the rift and that is insanely important and especially right now with someone like Vecna who could potentially abuse that. But if anything were to happen, I don't know if you could house extra people during a disaster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We are quite good at assembling makeshift and temporary lodging. The rock is our friend, if "you will."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's more, I think, what we would need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, of course! Not a worry."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Currently, Vecna is just north of Vasselheim, close to Pyrah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Have you asked Pyrah for aid, as well?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They've also been put on alert, but we have not personally been there yet since this has happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well. Good. They're closer. But we're happy to help if we can."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Things are happening very quickly. We just happened here first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're happy to help. Where are you off to?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Pools of Wittebak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What brings you towards the Pools of Wittebak?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know this place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is a series of poisoned wells and hulking, stupid giants."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hulking, stupid giants?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Giants? At the pools?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it was something about gnomes there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was once."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that something you can do, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're geothermic large puddles across the mountainside. Various minerals being lifted up "from the deep waters beneath the mountain. Heated, bubbling, boiling, steaming. But the giants moved "in hundreds of years ago, stomped around, and ended up filling the entire subterranean gnomish "city of Wittebak with fumes and poison. Killed most of them, and the rest fled to Kraghammer."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you all ever broach the area or do you just stay clear of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Best to avoid, we have our own business to deal with. And it's 100 miles from here. It's not "much of an issue."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And the pools are naturally poisonous?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, some are toxic, some are not, but since the giants moved in and ruptured some of the "natural formations, some of them have grown toxic or acidic, yes."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know if people still try to live there? We're looking for someone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If they are, they're foolish."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's our kind of people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe the person we're looking for is a giant.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know what type of giant? We've seen a few types of giants. Do you know their make and model?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The dumbest. Hill giants."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hill giants.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They'll eat anything, even small little gnomes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seems like they ate a lot of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughing) I guess so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pasty, I have a question. Do you know anything about Ioun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know of the name."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But not much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're not the most devoted people."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't imagine I'd have any information you wouldn't."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Just checking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My apologies."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This food is really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes! Enjoy your meal!" And he gets up and walks away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He was so officious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought we were walking into a fucking lake with gnomes living there. I didn't realize we were going to fight giants.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This got so much better all of a sudden.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If it were easy, it really wouldn't be us, would it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So the question is, is there actually someone of some minor intelligence living there that is this magical key, or did that person get eaten by a giant?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm inclined to believe the god. They're in the position where trying to trick us out of leaving is not necessary. They could've just told us to leave and be done with it. That information just wouldn't suit them, I don't think.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not saying it's bad information, I'm just wondering who the key is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's possible the key is now inside of a giant's stomach. In which case, it still would be inside of someone. Just a different someone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's like a Moby Dick situation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do recall the map that was shown to you by the Dawnfather Pelor. It was adjacent to the pools, not actually in the Pools of Wittebak. It was within a forest, and was a home.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I remember it now! It was a home inside. Oh, I drew a little map of it. Yep, that's it. Yes, it's adjacent to the pools, but there's a home in a forest. Did you like it? That's what my map was.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we theoretically just mist over everywhere?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean and look out for a home in the forest? We'll have to fly pretty low. I'm assuming the home is going to be covered by treetop.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We never travel traditionally anymore. I'm just saying, I miss the romantic aspects of traveling the countryside. It's like fast forward, immediate gratification, fucking you know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Dawnfather said we must hurry or else the world will end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's very far. We could Misty Step to the forest and then walk in the forest?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why are you fucking talking to me like I'm a child?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No reason, darling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Once this is all done, Grog, you and I will go on a long trek together.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah? Yeah. I dig that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't be dark and creepy and make it sound like you're being nice. I know you're being dark and creepy right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, hey. Don't get after my camping partner like that, all right? Shit. Chill.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can't predict this one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No marshmallows for this witch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is a little weird to be making promises, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, on that chipper little side note, I think we should turn in for the evening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, do we have lodging?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you wish to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I attune, either before I go to sleep or when I wake up, to the Dwarven Thrower instead of the Bloodaxe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may. All right. Any other attunements, anyone wishes to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll set the Deathwalker's Ward to acid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, to acid. Boom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before everyone else gets up, can I go find where Vax is sleeping?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a tent. What do I do? Do I knock? Do I shake it? I'm not sure. Scratch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're lodging made from large pieces of shale and rock, jammed into a somewhat triangular pattern to form an earth yurt, if you will.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oi. Vax. Are you naked?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Put some clothes on, then. Jesus. Keyleth, sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth opens the shamble door first with a little earth movement. I'm dressed. Yeah. I'm not like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't sleep naked?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go get coffee.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Keyleth darts off in the distance and the two of you are left within the tent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you decent?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm coming in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm still naked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh, come on! So fucking weird. (groans) I turn my back to him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start putting on the rest of my armor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I ask you a question? Well, I'm going to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course you can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I look down at my feet. Why didn't you ever try to take these back?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, they're going to be yours, anyway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Jesus. You know, the only reason I do things is that I take great joy in irritating you. If you don't show irritation, it makes it not worth it. (sighs) Can I turn around now? I'm turning around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am covered.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good. Why are you so calm? You're so calm and confident now. It's weird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, I'm on bonus time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he still cold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His skin is colder than a warm body, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I'm not Bobby Drake, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's his heartbeat like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (very slow heartbeat)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (groans) Jeez!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, way to hang onto that one, Matt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But look. (slashing noise) I mean, look.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there blood?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he bleeds, and it's a pretty open wound. You watch as the wound slowly seals itself up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasping) No fucking way!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, this is the dumbest conversation. This is bonus time. I shouldn't be here. It was the long sleep or come back and help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So she gave you the option and then you came back and now you're what? Super? Super half-elf?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I'm just following through on a promise made.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we defeat Vecna and you're done, you're gone. That's it? Instant? Is it like we kill him and you're gone that second or is it like we kill him and you're here for another week or until the Raven Queen realizes that you're still here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There isn't really a handbook.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She didn't tell you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When Vecna is destroyed, she will call me back to where I would be right now. I expect everyone-- Keyleth and I have barely spoken-- I expect everyone to be sad, but I wish you wouldn't be so sad, not exorbitantly so, because I--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Exorbitant? That's a good word.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the path that I have chosen for myself and I did it based out of desperation, at first. But everyone dies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I think our group has become a little spoiled. We're not your ordinary group of idiots. We have blessings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're blessed idiots.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Blessed idiots, yes, and I know that we've gotten used to feeling like we can overcome losing anyone, but your average farmer or seamstress doesn't come back. And everybody dies, and all that matters is what you do with what you have, and I have done a lot, and I've taken great pride watching all that you have done. And I have good friends and I have fallen in love. More than most, I've had.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. After you die, do you stand by her side?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That I don't really know. I imagine she'll keep me close.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you like her now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's necessary and she's of use, and I like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm glad you asked for them back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't have a lot of time. They really are my favorite thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Physical thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just make sure you write it down somewhere that after you go back to the Raven Queen that your sister is your favorite in the universe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dear, every stitch on my body is yours when I am gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want every stitch. None of it's worth you leaving.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slide my feet into the shoes and I wiggle my toes around. Oh, I'm sorry. I also have a confession to make.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't exactly have your shoes anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that I left them in the Feywild.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Feywild?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I think I dropped them into a bog. They didn't fit me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You are a motherfucker. You couldn't have just put them in the Bag of Holding?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm still me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great, wonderful. I like being barefoot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have very cute, small feet that fit in the boots that you gave me that did not fit my feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's probably shoes here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably. All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out her shoes and I put them down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, at least there's that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got your shoes back. Keyleth returns with some coffee. The rest of you come to consciousness, and the morning sun is now blaring down over the Cliffkeep. It's a strangely clear sky for the north. While a lot of it is relatively cold usually, you're used to seeing the snow- capped mountaintops-- oh, you found it! There you go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was with you the whole time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Must have been inside your shoes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh! I put it in the safe place and I didn't realize it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, chat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did they really know where I put it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they know where your shit is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The chat knew where you put your stuff?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "It's in the page in front of your blue divider."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No way!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, thank you. Thank you, guys!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many fingers am I holding up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So bringing it back in, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we have a guest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. At some point. So what do you guys want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Set off! For the Pools of Hatabah! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For the forest near the Pools of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The adjacent to the Pools of Hatafah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Forget it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, you are our extra muscle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: See! High five! Up top.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not dead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: His hand's cold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're traversing via your Wind Walk?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess. Are we wind walking there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (mispronouncing) Wind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (mispronouncing) Wind walk? Wind walking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (mispronouncing) Wil Wheaton!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, before we leave, real quick: Kiki.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you send messages or anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, man. We have been through this with our entire group so many times.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just you're so powerful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you need?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would send a letter, but it'll take weeks. So forget it. We'll be somewhere close to somewhere with magic soon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can leave it in the hands of the Ashari, see if they can find somebody.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You trust these folks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. They're all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: They're not the worst.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll scribble a little note and say-- well, no, there's no way they can get it to-- it's too far! It's too far!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was really excited to see your face when you handed it to them and they're like, what are we supposed to do with this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here, I'll show you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Write it out, bitch!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I write, a sphincter says what.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A. As. Good message. That's a big word at the front.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could have gotten the last one, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike taps you on the shoulder and is like, "I'll teach you that later."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for the Ashley Johnson simulator. That was weirdly comforting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Curse you, Blindspot!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Are we misting?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we eat a feast first, or should we save that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's save that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I don't know what we're going to find!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you guys. So preparations being done, you gather your materials, Keyleth completes the Wind Walk spell and you all feel yourselves grow slightly lighter on your toes. You concentrate. Over the minute transformation, you turn into your mist forms and take off in what direction?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Towards the Falafel Pools!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We wrote it down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Falafel pool is actually really tasty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pools of Wittebak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Towards the mountains!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He said "which direction?" He did not say "Where are you going?" He said "which direction?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We got to look at our map.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have it on the map!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have a map!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! Well, you have Terrah locked down. The Pools of Wittebak would not be on your specific map that you acquired earlier. You can ask around within Terrah within a brief time and figure it out. Somewhere between 100 and 120 miles, and he points in a specific direction. You mark the sun's traveling and where certain landmarks are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I quickly do the math of how fast I can travel and be like okay, it shouldn't take long.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an eastward direction from where you are.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You did actually, legitimately point east, too, which makes that even better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's weird.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that is weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who is leading this venture?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've been there. No, I knew of it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You knew of it, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I don't know exactly where.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: After listening to everybody, I'll lead the way. That way, I can keep an eye out for the forest next, too, and the house and all the things we're looking for. I got a good look at the map that Pelor held up in front of us, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Okay, cool. I need you to go ahead and make a survival check. Actually, for this, I'm gonna say-- yeah, because it would be tracking in the wilderness. So survival.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Survival? Great. Any advantage on that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wilderness is your favored terrain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mountains, technically.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's also my favored.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then yeah, roll again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because that was a one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! So much better. 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that'll do it. Your speed is tremendous when in this form, so what would have been an extended trek on foot over a series of days, it takes you mere hours to eventually get to a point where you crest one heavy peak. On the opposite side, you can see down the cliffside, the edge reaches a slight precipice, and there you can see what looks to be for a mile or so a cluster of dozens and dozens of pools of water of different sizes, all jammed together in a geothermic cluster, where you can see bright greens that move to a deep orange-maroon at the edges from the various mineral deposits that have collected over hundreds and hundreds of years. You can see large columns of smoke and steam of different chemical colors rising out of various large pools, and at a glance down, you can see a number of shapes: a number of hulking, humanoid shapes; somewhere in the neighborhood of 40 to 50 or so scattered at different pools, moving in small clusters or gangs. Some of them are jumping in, cannonballing and swimming through the actual pools. Some of them are lounging around and lying. Some of them appear to be returning, dragging things from the nearby forest on the eastern side of the bank.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is a vacation spot. What's that water park nearby?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wet 'N' Wild?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, for a few hundred years, you get the sense that the Pools of Wittebak have been a hill giant water park. You can see these large mounds of mud and scrap wood and things that have been built into these large hill giant domiciles onto the side of the mountain not far from the pools. It's become a definite hill giant wandering zone. So do you guys continue over the pools, down towards the nearby forest ridge?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, past the pools.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a few hundred-- I'd say, actually more than that. A thousand or more feet away from that precipice before plants even begin to grow. It looks like whatever toxic chemicals have burbled up in some of these pools have made a lot of the ground there unable to give any forest life or sustain any large trees. As soon as the forest begins, it's a dense little pocket, maybe a mile and a half, two miles across. That's what you've got. What do you guys want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh man. I should try to track any footprints in there and see if there's something around the edges, maybe, that lead back to-- shit, I don't fucking know. It's only a couple of miles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you guys begin to do a loop-over, who's doing a quick pass over the patch of forest? All right, make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's the forest. Do I get advantage on that one? Perception? What is that, 21? 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Glancing over, you don't see any major glades or clearings. There doesn't appear to be any sign of bastions of civilization or any sort of logging going on. There's no areas where trees have been cut or cleared. It's a featureless forest top, from what you can see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we fly down lower to where we're in between the trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go down into the forest, if you'd like. All right, who's going into the forest, then?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll go. All of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with Pike following suit, you guys all swoop down through the boughs of the trees and into the center of the forest itself. Within there, it's not a super thick canopy; it's not as heavy as the Feywild or some of the recent forests that cluster around Vasselheim. There are breaks in the canopy where you can see the sunbeams come through from the morning sun that's rising up higher and higher in the sky as you've traveled. The mist has burned away in this area, so it's a nice, warm forest. Glancing about, there is a lot of life in here. You can see signs of squirrels. You rush by what was a family of wolverine-like creatures that are rustling by. As soon as the wind scoots in and your mist forms come rocketing past, they all scatter and run off into the shadows. There's a lot of forest ground here to cover. For you to really super track with advantage, you'd have to go into human form. I'd give you a regular roll if you want to try and track in your mist form.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not so much tracking right now, just a loose passover as we're going, looking for any kind of hunting traps or trails, signs of life of things that have been traversed a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27. Begin coasting through tree after tree through small, tiny bits of clearing that immediately come into large clusters of trunks and knotted branches that all merge and cluster at different intersections. After about 20 or so minutes of this, trying to do a large spiral around the forest inward, out of the corner of your eye, Vex'ahlia, you glance over and see a quick glimpse of something that appears to be more structured. You look back and rush over and there you see amongst the trees what appears to be a humble-looking two-story home. You see a small balcony built on the second floor that goes over one of the larger rooms in the bottom floor. It's not huge, by any means, and is hidden by a lot of the local brush and trees there. Can't get a lot more detail at this distance, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. We land. I land.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I follow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And behind a tree, I'm going to take form.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take your form? Okay. So all of you land and follow Vex?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all take a minute to go back to your physical forms. You glance over, and there it is, standing before you. It's very shaded in this part of the forest. You can see a little bit of what looks to be interior light, very faint.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a normal person-sized dwelling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you could walk in it. Proportionally, it looks maybe like it was built for a little bit of a smaller person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to start eyeballing the ground of the house for any kinds of traps set out. Is that investigation, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is investigation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. Okay. So you guys begin to slowly--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait. Before we do, there are no random nudist giants that have run over in this area, right? There's nobody sees us over here taking off?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're worried about giants streaking?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not particularly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, yeah, have you ever seen a giant naked? You'll never forget it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I might. I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you suggesting we set up a perimeter?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! I mean, it's a tiny house, I don't really want to go in there. I like having exits I fit through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want whoever it is to think that we threaten them in any way. But then, if they threaten us, I wouldn't want them to attack us, either.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll just knock the house down from the outside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's keep this structure standing for now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll stay outside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we knocking properly or are we just going to Invisibility in and see who's in there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like maybe knock properly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you think long and hard about it, it's not like manners have failed us very often.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. But do keep an eye out for traps or anything weird on the way up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we've failed at manners often.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We fail at manners more often. We'll see how this goes. We'll try being nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll stay out here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go knock on the door. It seems like a smallish door, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll go with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so what's the marching order?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nothing perked up my spidey-sense?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this current glance, no. You guys are behind a tree at a distance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No nude giants, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, no, but you're keeping an eye out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm walking with a smile, looking very friendly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's leading the charge?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go knock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll walk behind Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have Scanlan and Vex'ahlia.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to go, as well, and continue to eyeball for traps.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be hanging back a bit, as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be comfortably back, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before we knock, what were we told was in this thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The key.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The key. Inside a person, inside a house.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's possible the person is the key; we're not sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is Trinket within your necklace for this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he's out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Trinket is out alongside you. Grog?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a very friendly bear, look at him!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm outside the house.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, smile! Be friendly!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you get across this small walkway towards the front, as you're walking with a big smile, Vex'ahlia, something catches your eye on the ground right before her and you watch as she steps forward. You reach out and grab her wrist and hold her back before she steps down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a large, rusted, iron bear trap that is open that you almost stepped right into.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That would be have been donesies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was being friendly, and it almost crushed me. Trinket, be careful, this thing was made for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket walks up to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, be careful! Spit on it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (growling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can he spit? Can Trinket spit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bear spitting) It's not very-- it's more of a power drool, if you will.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it easy enough to walk around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can walk around that one, and you begin to see what looks to be seven other ones that are clustered around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is probably a giant-infested forest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, that's exactly why. Bear traps are the biggest thing you can get for a giant.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we evade them and get into--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to walk around. Yeah, you would, actually. As you step around one, you can see, at the front door, there is a welcome mat that says "welcome." As you're approaching it, you can see the welcome mat, there's just something a little off about it. Like, it's raised higher than the ground should be.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Willkommen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Trapped?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I could attempt to dicker with it, but we could just knock the door over it if we really are going on manners.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Double-check to make sure the door isn't a problem, either. I'd imagine if the welcome mat is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The door's going to blow up if we knock on it? I mean, we don't have much luck with doors.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I grab a stick and lift the edge of the mat up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you stopping her from doing that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I am! Let me take a look at it, please! I've already detected it. I will attempt to disarm it with thieves' tools, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's fine. That is a 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a small cord that is hidden amongst the brush that runs from underneath the mat through a small ring that goes up from the house, then up a branch or vine, so it's hidden amongst them. You look straight up about 40 feet, you see a nice, solid, thick trunk that is just (creaking).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's some Predator shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right above the door.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like there's a complicated story that goes along with all of this. I'm really excited by it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this going to be an Uncharted kind of adventure?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have found the cabin of Macaulay Culkin!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So knowing this, you walk over and grab the cord. Looking to see where the leverage is, you motion to Grog to come over and hold it. You find another piece of heavy stone that is by the wall to the side. With Grog's help, you snip it, bring it over, and tie it onto the edge of this piece of the stonework, like a small pole that was placed at the base of the house. It holds the weight of this suspended trunk and it no longer triggers based on the step.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy, I'm sorry, I know you like a good Rube Goldberg.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was really excited by this thing. It's a shame to dismantle it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's still there. Maybe when we leave, we can crash it down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does the door look hinky at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You did say kinky, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I said hinky. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. It does not appear to be trapped, per se. It does appear to be locked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, well, I don't want to pick it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to use a stick, and oh! Here, Scanlan, you were going to knock.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (chuckles) What is this stick?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that you don't have to touch the door in case it's magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's still pretty big for a gnomish home, meaning it's a little more spacious headroom, you'd probably be able to stand in comfortably, except for you, Grog, you're probably a little hunched.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Little more than is needed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like me. I'll just rap on the door with my knuckles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. There is an awkward pause.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello? Bidet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm glad he didn't murder us with his bear traps.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You need this? Oh, you need this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, chaotic evil necromancer gnome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You weren't supposed to tell them.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I didn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you hear amongst your business for the day, out of nowhere (knocking) on the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kaitiaki!

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I open it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you hear (clicking) what sounds like six or seven different locks unlock on the door, as it slowly swings open, and before them what do they see?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: A very small, elderly gnome, bald on top, with a long white beard, and a bit of a distant look in his eyes, and he looks at you and says, are you real?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: You're real? Prove it! Say that you're real to my invisible frog companion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) I'm real.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Demistrik, show them out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as two tiny red claws come around the corner as these tiny, impish wings unfurl. You watch as a tiny imp releases from the edge of the doorframe. (wings beating) "Get out!" (door slamming) and slams the door.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: And show yourself out, Demistrik. I don't need you here, 19 years of you is more than enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You gave me permission to stay. If anyone is going to leave,

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I think you should go to Kraghammer and become a circus performer with a little tin cup and a little hat and say, "Oh dear, I am Demistrik, the magical imp." That's where you belong, I tell you right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sounds like a lot more fun than having to deal with you on a daily basis, you son of a--"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: (offended cry) Language, imp!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door creaks open once more. "Sorry." (door closing)

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: The door creaks open again. I'm sorry, as well. (whispering) For him, he's

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I stick my foot in!

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: No! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm really very sorry to bother you, although I'm delighted to make your acquaintance. I'm having a very hard time not just smiling like an idiot. Could we trouble you just for a few moments? We mean no harm at all. We do need to talk to you. We've come a very long way... as farts. That's got to count for something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sing-songy) We could give you some interesting conversation. 35 years is a very long time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've done a lot, we've seen a lot, we could tell you all about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I play an old, traditional gnome song to soften him a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a performance check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is an old gnome song?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been a long time since you've heard music, let alone one that scratches an old memory of childhood. It's nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's more or less whatever strikes your fancy, to be fair.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (humming Going to the Chapel)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the imp in the back going, "Ugh! Stop that racket!"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: You don't even appreciate music. What would an imp song sound like? You can't say one, can you? Because you don't have music where you're from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can, but it'll cause your ears to bleed! It sounds like this." (screeching)

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I find that very entertaining.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're such a liar!" The imp (poof) vanishes before you.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: He's gone. Don't worry about him. He gets a little bit... testy, if you will.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: May we speak? May we have a moment of your time?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh, well... Very well. You can come in if you like. Oh! Be careful, there's illusions and thingamabobbers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (stammers) Sorry, that's infectious. We have a really big guy. Are you all right with him coming in? Grog, are you all right with coming in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How the fuck do I get in that damn door?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have you not crawled on all fours before?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You should try it if you haven't; it's quite delightful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you lying?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. For once, no, I'm not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I do an insight check on Percy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have never actually been quite so honest in my entire life. I think you'll find it very therapeutic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I roll in on all fours.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How does it feel?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm waiting for it to kick in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Crawl forward, back a bit, stretch, downward dog, stretch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as this large, gray-skinned mountain of a man crawls his way in. You could duck-walk through if you really wanted to. This is worse than Gandalf in Bag End. All fours is probably the most comfortable means of transport through the house. But you walk in and immediately, you watch as your new gnomish friend is going around and quickly disabling small things, putting small keys and tying off strings and wires you saw that were set up around portions of the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am going to try and map this in my head, the crazy stuff I'm seeing right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This place is a hoarder's den. You see shelves and shelves of books and papers and scrolls and stacks of them. You see on bits of furniture and chairs more stacks of books and sacks and satchels and quills and inkwells. Some spilled and left and dried long ago. This place is very lived-in, very chaotic, and very unique.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The first thing that I do as we come in is I scan the room, or rooms, for more Macaulay Culkin shenanigans.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maculkins. I think we can just call them Maculkins now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You do see there's one portion of the floor that he keeps avoiding, instinctually, that catches your attention. You're like, "why does he keep walking around that?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's your name, friend?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh, well, that was taken from me a very long time ago. I only have what they call me. You know, names are an odd thing, aren't they? Sometimes a name can stick to you like blood on a knife or your fingers on a wallet that might not be your property, and then who you were is not who you are and yet... here we are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That oddly made way too much sense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do they call you?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: They call me Sprigg. There's more. They call me Sprigg the Obnoxious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sprigg the Obnoxious?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Yes. It's not my given name; it was a name that was given to me when it was given to me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you used to be obnoxious? Because I'm not picking that up.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh. We're rarely who we used to be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there mercury in those pools? (laughter)

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Who? Is that a friend of yours?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I sometimes will talk to the fourth wall. It's a thing; ignore it.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: It's a domicile. There has to be four walls. If there weren't, it would be a yurt. I don't live in a yurt, dear boy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I sometimes live in a yurt. They're quite nice.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: (wheezing laughter) Demistrik!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The imp just appears across the room and just goes, "Good one. That was-- I am "so sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike? Do you think maybe a Greater Restoration is in order?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike goes, "Why?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No reason.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Could I just touch your hand for a second? Is that okay?"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: (stuttering) Why?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just to see if we can help your day."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Do you not think that I'm real?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably not."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I assure you, I'm real. I'm here. My companions are long gone. They were like you, like you, like you, and you, and you, and I'm all that is left. You are looking into a mirror of your future.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to look like you, or you're going to look like me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I know what he means. Who were your companions?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Memories. They're all memories now. I don't even remember their names. I remember some of them, but we were heroes and now I am here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Were there no other gnome folk in your party?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: No, there was one like you, there was a big one, a mighty one. There was one like you, brave and kind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's like me! That's exactly like me.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: There was one like you. Smart, yet sad. And you, as well. Yeah, and I was you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike goes, "Please?" She grabs your hand and concentrates for a second, you watch as the holy symbol flares for a moment and the warmth passes through her arms into your hand. And it feels nice. It's like holding a freshly heated cup of tea. And as the spell completes and she pulls back. "That's all. Thank you."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Thank you, very kind of you. Don't ever do that again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, okay. Okay."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How long ago did they go away? Perish?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: 37 years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And how, was it in a fight?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Against a powerful entity?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh no. Against ignorance, against bravery that should never have been. And that's why I'm here and they're not, because I ran, you see. I'm your future. You'll all be gone. You and you and you and you and you, and you'll be left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While listening to all that, Vax slid his hand into Keyleth's and quietly listened to the whole thing.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh, well. Perhaps we should talk of other things. Should we?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Yes, we want this to be a positive visit for you, so is there anything we can tell you from the world outside that you might be curious about?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: The world outside? Who needs the world outside? I have everything here, and what I need, dear boy, I have taken from Kraghammer. All these books over there, you see, those are mine. They should have been mine to begin with, and I took them, and now they are mine. (wheezing laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to peruse some of these titles, quietly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The books, you mean?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Yes. You'd like to look at the books, would you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I find it's the easiest way to learn quite a bit about a person.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Love, no. Sadness, bravery, power. What do you have that you would give me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach in the Bag of Holding. I take out Percy's glasses. Would you care for a pair of these testicl-- spectacles?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I seek power, dear boy, not silliness. If I wanted silliness, I would talk to a Sun Tree. No one ever should talk to a Sun Tree, they should only listen to a Sun Tree. And so I shall say again, if you would like to peruse my book and perhaps find what you are looking for, what will you give me that would bring power and redemption into my life?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you have, Grog?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Give him some ale.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But that's not fucking power.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't know. Bet it's been a while since he's had some of that.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: It seems you have powerful items.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do. I have these Bracers of Defense.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Ah, but that is strength. I require power.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (softly) Shit. Fuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I reach into my bag and start cleaning a small green shard of residuum, polishing it.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Demistrik! If you excuse me for a just-- while you look, I'll just talk to my imp. You'll pardon us. (whispering) A word, Demistrik?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ugh. Just one moment. What?"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: The big one worries me. I think we should have a code in case we have to jump him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What code would you wish?"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: We need to remember that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Goliath grab. Good luck!"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: We need some sort of mnemonic device to remember goliath grab. G, goodness gracious, grab that goliath. O?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "O? Huh. I'll tell you what, I've got your back."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I don't feel that at all. You're right in front of me. How could you have my back? (wheezing chuckle) I got you. (laughing) Go away. So what do you have for me? You've had ample time to look in your Bag of Holding to produce something very--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Powerful. Well, I do have one thing that seems to be pretty powerful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pull out of the Bag of Holding a small leather case. I open the flap. I don't know if you have any interest in this, but my experience with these items has been very extreme. Would you care to take a card?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Would you care to give them to me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All or just one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, you can pick a card.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check. Roll a d20 and add your arcana skill modifier to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are a madman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. You don't recognize what he's holding in his hands, but you immediately see the leather casing around it, and your essence being able to read certain elements of magic-- It does appear to be a powerful enchantment, whatever he has procured from the bag.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Indeed. Perhaps one card for one book?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, sure. I mean, Percy, do you have a book out of all of these that you want to read?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: What are you looking for? What do you seek? What knowledge? I've got it all here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We seek a key.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To find a very ancient goddess--

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh, don't say Ioun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not going to say Ioun.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: You just did!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there another name that you would like us to use? Like a nickname instead of Ioun?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: The Broken Goddess. I know more than Ioun, please! Ioun. Gods, what do they know? We know more than they, for we exist! We live! We adventure! They merely observe. Am I right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have a point. They don't do much for us in the day-to-day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you saying you know more than Ioun?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Of course I know more than Ioun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you prove that you know more than Ioun?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So if I ask you a question that is almost impossible to answer, you could answer it before Ioun could answer it?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Could Ioun create a rock so heavy that even she couldn't lift it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, please. I'm far too clever to ask such a simple question. That's easy. I would have to ask something that was very difficult to answer.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I will give you your answer if you give me a card.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, I was just saying what a good idea I thought it was, but I thought you were talking about the entire deck, Grog. I think the entire deck is a fairer thing than to have him pull a card, because that seems unpredictable to me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that sounds perfect to me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're all in a small, enclosed space together, Grog, and I like this fellow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sprigg, it is quite powerful, yes, but also maybe slightly dangerous.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A bit dangerous, to be fair.

lines.name: DARIN
